TEXT.German: Konquistador

TEXT.English: As wished by our King, we have accepted peace negotiations with %s1_nation.
TEXT.French: Conformément aux souhaits du Roi, nous avons accepté les négociations de paix avec %s1_nation.
TEXT.German: Wie durch den König gewünscht, haben wir den Friedensverhandlungen mit %s1_nation zugestimmt. Die Diplomaten haben sich nach der Verhandlung entschieden zu bleiben.
TEXT.Italian: As wished by our King, we have accepted peace negotiations with %s1_nation.
TEXT.Spanish: As wished by our King, we have accepted peace negotiations with %s1_nation.

TEXT.English: We have refused peace negotiations with %s1_nation. The King is unhappy with our decision.
TEXT.French: Nous avons rejeté les négociations de paix avec %s1_nation. Le Roi est mécontent.
TEXT.German: Wir haben die Friedensverhandlungen mit %s1_nation abgelehnt.
TEXT.Italian: We have refused peace negotiations with %s1_nation. The King is unhappy with our decision.
TEXT.Spanish: We have refused peace negotiations with %s1_nation. The King is unhappy with our decision.

TEXT.English: You are going to abandon this city.
TEXT.French: Vous allez abandonner cette colonie.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, wenn Ihr alle Bewohner dieser Siedlung ihre Habseligkeiten packen lasst und sie fortschickt, wird der Ort verlassen sein und von der Karte getilgt werden.
TEXT.Italian: You are going to abandon this city.
TEXT.Spanish: You are going to abandon this city.

TEXT.English: City %s1_city has been abandoned.
TEXT.French: La Colonie de %s1_city a été abandonnée.
TEXT.German: Die letzten Bürger haben %s1_city den Rücken gekehrt. Die Hütten werden verfallen, und bald wird sich niemand mehr dieses Ortes entsinnen.
TEXT.Italian: City %s1_city has been abandoned.
TEXT.Spanish: City %s1_city has been abandoned.

TEXT.English: Abandoning a city is not possible during war.
TEXT.French: L'abandon d'une colonie est impossible en temps de guerre.
TEXT.German: Gouverneur, es herrscht Krieg, und die Siedler fürchten sich, die schützende Siedlung aufzugeben.
TEXT.Italian: Abandoning a city is not possible during war.
TEXT.Spanish: Abandoning a city is not possible during war.

TEXT.English: This city currently does not want to trade with you.
TEXT.French: Cette colonie resuse de commercer avec vous
TEXT.German: Das Volk der %s1_Civ möchte zur Zeit nicht mit euch handeln.
TEXT.Italian: This city currently does not want to trade with you.
TEXT.Spanish: This city currently does not want to trade with you.

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raid on %s2_city! A %s3_BldngName was destroyed by raiding party!
TEXT.French: Les %s1_civ_adjective ont lancé un raid sur la ville : %s2_city ! [NUM1:Un:Une] %s3_BldngName [NUM1:a été détruit:a été détruite] par des ennemis infiltrés !
TEXT.German: %s2_city wurde Opfer eines %s1:2_civ_adjective Überfalls! Das Gebäude %s3_BldngName wurde von feindlichen Eindringlingen zerstört!
TEXT.Italian: Raid %s1_civ_adjective a %s2_city! Infiltrati nemici hanno distrutto [NUM1:un:una] %s3_BldngName !
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Una incursión de los %s1:3_civ_adjective en %s2_city! ¡Los enemigos infiltrados han destruido [NUM1:un:una:unos:unas] %s3_BldngName !

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raid on %s2_city! All %s3_buildName progress was destroyed by raiding party!
TEXT.French: Les %s1_civ_adjective ont lancé un raid sur la ville : %s2_city ! Toutes les progressions du bâtiment : %s3_buildName ont été détruites par les infiltrateurs ennemis !
TEXT.German: %s2_city wurde Opfer eines %s1:2_civ_adjective Überfalls! Der gesamte Fortschritt bei der Errichtung des Gebäudes %s3_buildName wurde von gegnerischen Eindringlingen zerstört!
TEXT.Italian: Raid %s1_civ_adjective a %s2_city! Tutti i progressi in %s3_buildName sono stati distrutti da nemici infiltrati!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Una incursión de los %s1:3_civ_adjective en %s2_city! ¡Los infiltrados enemigos han destruido todo el progreso [NUM1:del:de la:de los:de las] %s3_buildName!

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raid on %s2_city! %d3[ICON_GOLD] of our state treasury was looted by raiding party!
TEXT.French: Les %s1_civ_adjective ont lancé un raid sur la ville : %s2_city ! %d3[ICON_GOLD] de notre trésor a été pillée par des ennemis infiltrés !
TEXT.German: %s2_city wurde Opfer eines %s1:2_civ_adjective Überfalls! Feindliche Eindringlingen haben einen %d3[ICON_GOLD] unseres Staatsschatzes erbeutet!
TEXT.Italian: Raid %s1_civ_adjective a %s2_city! Infiltrati nemici hanno rubato %d3[ICON_GOLD] del nostro tesoro di stato!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Una incursión de los %s1:3_civ_adjective en %s2_city! ¡Los enemigos infiltrados han saqueado %d3[ICON_GOLD] de nuestro tesoro!

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raid on %s2_city! Raiding party takes scalps, %s3_unit killed
TEXT.French: Les %s1_civ_adjective ont lancé un raid sur la ville : %s2_city ! %s3_unit a subi des dégâts
TEXT.German: %s2_city wurde Opfer eines %s1:2_civ_adjective Überfalls! %s3_unit Es hat Opfer gegeben
TEXT.Italian: Raid %s1_civ_adjective a %s2_city! sono morti %s3_unit
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Una incursión de los %s1:3_civ_adjective en %s2_city! Se lamenta la pérdida de %s3_unit

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raid on %s2_city! Raiding party attacks harbor, your %s3_unit was damaged!
TEXT.French: Les %s1_civ_adjective ont lancé un raid sur la ville : %s2_city ! Votre %s3_unit a subi des dégâts infligés!
TEXT.German: %s2_city wurde Opfer eines %s1:2_civ_adjective Überfalls! %s3_unit beschädigt!
TEXT.Italian: Raid %s1_civ_adjective a %s2_city! La tua unità %s3_unit è stata danneggiata!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Una incursión de los %s1:3_civ_adjective en %s2_city! [NUM2:ha dañado:ha dañado:han dañado:han dañado] a [NUM1:vuestro:vuestra:vuestros:vuestras] %s3_unit !

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raiding party wiped out in %s2_city! Nothing destroyed or stolen.
TEXT.French: %s1_civ_adjective raiding party wiped out in %s2_city! Nothing destroyed or stolen.

TEXT.Spanish: %s1_civ_adjective raiding party wiped out in %s2_city! Nothing destroyed or stolen.

TEXT.English: %s1_civ_adjective raiding party captured in %s2_city ! They will pay with labour for their crimes.

TEXT.English: Your Missionary was not successful when trying to convince the Natives of this village of the evilness of their white neighbours.
TEXT.French: Your Missionary was not successful when trying to convince the Natives of this village of the evilness of their white neighbours.
TEXT.German: Euer Missionar war bei dem Versuch, die Einwohner dieses Dorfes von der Bösartigkeit ihrer weissen Nachbarn zu überzeugen, nicht erfolgreich.
TEXT.Italian: Your Missionary was not successful when trying to convince the Natives of this village of the evilness of their white neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: Your Missionary was not successful when trying to convince the Natives of this village of the evilness of their white neighbours.

TEXT.English: Your Missionary successfully convinced some young Natives of this village to raid their evil white neighbours.
TEXT.French: Your Missionary successfully convinced some young Natives of this village to raid their evil white neighbours.
TEXT.German: Euer Missionar hat die Einwohner dieses Dorfes erfolgreich zu einem Überfall auf ihre bösen weißen Nachbarn überzeugt.
TEXT.Italian: Your Missionary successfully convinced some young Natives of this village to raid their evil white neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: Your Missionary successfully convinced some young Natives of this village to raid their evil white neighbours.

TEXT.English: The Prisoners we have bought from our King have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: The Prisoners we have bought from our King have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.German: Die Gefangenen, die wir erworben haben, sind in %s1_city angekommen, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: The Prisoners we have bought from our King have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: The Prisoners we have bought from our King have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: It takes years to acquire the knowledge, contacts and rhetorical ability to become a successful Statesman. However, most Noblemen had very good education and had been prepared for a life in high society from their birth on. Their knowledge of law and legal proceedings makes them crucial to maintaining order and discipline in a growing colony. Further, their strength, passion and skill as orators makes them powerful weapons for a colony wishing to become its own nation.
TEXT.French: Il faut des années pour acquérir le savoir, le contact et la rhétorique nécessaires pour devenir un grand Homme d'Etat. Sa connaissance de la loi et des procédures légales lui fait jouer un rôle clé dans le maintien de l'ordre et de la discipline d'une colonie en pleine expansion. En outre, sa force, sa passion et son talent d'orateur en font une arme puissante pour toute colonie désireuse d'accéder à l'indépendance.
TEXT.German: Man braucht Jahre, um das Wissen, die Kontakte und die rhetorischen Fähigkeiten zu erlangen, die man benötigt, um ein erfolgreicher Staatsmann zu sein. Ein Edelmann wurde aber meist seit Kindheit auf Diplomatie und Politik vorbereitet. Des weiteren sind Geld und Bekanntheit seit jeher wichtige Einflussfaktoren. Manche Edelnmänner der Alten Welt werden vom Reiz des Abenteuers oder vom Ruf idealistischer neuer Pfade in die Neue Welt gezogen und stellen ihren Einfluss den dortigen Kräften zur Verfügung.
TEXT.Italian: Ci vogliono anni per acquisire la conoscenza, i contatti e l'abilità retorica per diventare uno statista di successo. La conoscenza della legge e dei procedimenti legali rende gli statisti cruciali per il mantenimento dell'ordine e della disciplina in una colonia in crescita. Inoltre la loro forza, passione e abilità come oratori li rendono potenti armi per una colonia che vuole trasformarsi in nazione.
TEXT.Spanish: Cuesta años conseguir el conocimiento, los contactos y la capacidad retórica necesarios para ser un Estadista de éxito. Su conocimiento de las normas y de los procedimientos legales hace que sean cruciales para mantener el orden y la disciplina en una colonia creciente. Además, su fuerza, su pasión y su habilidad como oradores los convierte en armas poderosas para un asentamiento que desee independizarse.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Noblemen[COLOR_REVERT] are expert [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Liberty Bell[COLOR_REVERT] producers. They are even more effective, than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Statesmen[COLOR_REVERT], but also very rare.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hommes d'Etat aguerris[COLOR_REVERT] sont d'excellents producteurs de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cloches de la liberté[COLOR_REVERT]. En assignant un Homme d'Etat aguerri à la profession d'Homme d'Etat, vous doublerez le nombre de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cloches de la liberté[COLOR_REVERT] produites.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Edelmänner[COLOR_REVERT] sind hervorragende [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freiheitsglocken[COLOR_REVERT]produzenten. Sie sind sogar noch effektiver als ein Staatsmann, allerdings auch viel seltener.
TEXT.Italian: Gli [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]statisti anziani[COLOR_REVERT] sono esperti produttori di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]campane della libertà[COLOR_REVERT]. Assegnandone uno alla professione di statista raddoppierai il numero di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]campane della libertà[COLOR_REVERT] prodotte.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Estadistas mayores[COLOR_REVERT] son expertos productores de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Campanas de la libertad[COLOR_REVERT]. Asignar a uno de ellos a la profesión de Estadista doblará el número de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Campanas de la libertad[COLOR_REVERT] producidas.

TEXT.Spanish: The Famous Noble from Europe has arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Hunting and Trapping wild animals like Deers and Beavers used to be a very lonely job far away from civlization and people in the cities. During the months of the hunting seasons the hunters and trappers lived in their trappers huts and left usually left those only for selling their furs.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Hunting and Trapping wild animals like Deers and Beavers used to be a very lonely job far away from civlization and people in the cities. During the months of the hunting seasons the hunters and trappers lived in their trappers huts and left usually left those only for selling their furs.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Jagd auf Rehe, Biber und andere Tiere fand meist weit abseits der Städte statt. Während der Jagdsaison lebten die Jäger und Trapper oft monatelang in einsamen Jagdhütten und verliessen diese nur zum Verkauf ihrer Waren in den Städten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Hunting and Trapping wild animals like Deers and Beavers used to be a very lonely job far away from civlization and people in the cities. During the months of the hunting seasons the hunters and trappers lived in their trappers huts and left usually left those only for selling their furs.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Hunting and Trapping wild animals like Deers and Beavers used to be a very lonely job far away from civlization and people in the cities. During the months of the hunting seasons the hunters and trappers lived in their trappers huts and left usually left those only for selling their furs.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cocoa Plantations are usually a mixture of many different kinds of trees and not a monoculture. This ensures a healthy environment for the precious fruits.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Cocoa Plantations are usually a mixture of many different kinds of trees and not a monoculture. This ensures a healthy environment for the precious fruits.

TEXT.English: Colonists assigned to work on a plot where breeding horses is possible may take on the Rancher profession (if horses for breeding are available in the city) and thus increase the number of new [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] in your colony each turn. Assigning a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Rancher[COLOR_REVERT] to this profession will significantly increase the number of Horses your colony births.
TEXT.French: Colonists assigned to work on a plot where breeding horses is possible may take on the Rancher profession (if horses for breeding are available in the city) and thus increase the number of new [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] in your colony each turn. Assigning a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Rancher[COLOR_REVERT] to this profession will significantly increase the number of Horses your colony births.
TEXT.German: Siedler, die einem Geländefeld zugewiesen werden, auf dem das Züchten von Pferden möglich ist, können den Beruf des Ranchers annehmen, falls in der Stadt genügend Pferde zur Zucht vorhanden sind. Dadurch wird dann jede Runde die Anzahl der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pferde[COLOR_REVERT] in der Kolonie erhöht. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meister Rancher[COLOR_REVERT] können Pferde doppelt so schnell züchten, wie andere Siedler.
TEXT.Italian: Colonists assigned to work on a plot where breeding horses is possible may take on the Rancher profession (if horses for breeding are available in the city) and thus increase the number of new [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] in your colony each turn. Assigning a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Rancher[COLOR_REVERT] to this profession will significantly increase the number of Horses your colony births.

Assigning a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Rancher[COLOR_REVERT] to this profession will significantly increase the number of Horses your colony births.

TEXT.English: Horses

[TAB]Arguably the most useful domesticated animal in mankind's history, horses have existed for some 50 million years. While significant evolution has taken place (early ancestors were under a foot tall), the basic appearance of the horse has remained relatively unchanged. The earliest interaction between horses and men was that of game, with early man hunting them for food. Around 2500 BC, the first signs of domesticated breeds began appearing in Asia, but the idea took hold and spread rapidly. The contributions of the horse to man's conquest of his fellow man were immense, enabling the vast campaigns by Genghis Khan and Alexander the Great. The Spaniards introduced the modern breed to North America in the 16th Century, often turning their imported herds loose before returning to Europe (making valuable room for gold and other treasures). While the importance of horses has dwindled since the advent of the internal combustion engine, they remain a boon in the realms of entertainment and farming.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le cheval est apparu il y a quelque 50 millions d'années, et a été sans doute l'animal domestique le plus utile de toute l'histoire de l'humanité. Le cheval a sensiblement évolué au cours des siècles (son plus ancien ancêtre mesurait moins de 30 cm), mais son apparence générale est restée relativement la même. L'homme a d'abord chassé le cheval pour sa viande. Les premières traces de domestication du cheval, apparue en Asie, remontent à 2500 av. J.-C. Mais cette pratique s'est répandue rapidement. Le cheval a considérablement contribué aux guerres de conquête, permettant à Gengis Khan ou Alexandre le Grand de mener de vastes campagnes. C'est au XVIe siècle que les Espagnols introduisent le cheval moderne en Amérique du Nord. Des troupeaux entiers ont alors été relâchés pour faire de la place sur les bateaux, les Espagnols préférant rentrer avec les soutes pleines d'or et d'autres trésors. Bien que l'importance du cheval ait diminué depuis l'invention du moteur à combustion, il reste très prisé pour les loisirs et l'agriculture.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Pferde gibt es seit mehr als 50 Millionen Jahren. Sie sind die wohl nützlichsten domestizierten Tiere in der Geschichte der Menschheit. Obwohl sich ihr Äußeres im Laufe der Jahre kaum verändert hat, haben die Pferde eine bedeutende Evolution durchlaufen. Immerhin waren ihre frühzeitlichen Artgenossen nur etwa 30 cm groß. Ursprünglich jagten die Menschen Pferde zu Nahrungszwecken. Erst um 2500 vor Christus tauchten die ersten domestizierten Züchtungen in Asien auf. Diese Idee wurde so gut angenommen, dass sie sich schnell in andere Länder ausbreitete. Ihr Beitrag zur Ausbreitung der Völker war enorm, da erst die Pferde die gewaltigen Feldzüge Dschingis Khans und Alexanders des Großen ermöglichten. Im 16. Jahrhundert brachten die Spanier die heutigen Pferderassen nach Nordamerika. Oft ließen sie dort ihre Herden zurück, um auf ihren Schiffen mehr Platz für Gold und andere erbeutete Schätze zu haben. Obwohl die Bedeutung des Pferdes seit der Erfindung des Verbrennungsmotors deutlich rückläufig ist, hat es in der Landwirtschaft und im Sport bis heute einen festen Platz.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I cavalli esistono da 50 milioni di anni e sono senza dubbio gli animali più utili nella storia dell'umanità. Malgrado si siano evoluti in maniera rilevante (i loro antenati erano alti poco meno di 30 centimetri), il loro aspetto è rimasto praticamente invariato. Inizialmente, gli uomini erano soliti andare a caccia di cavalli per cibarsene, ma, attorno al 2500 a. C., in Asia apparvero i primi segni di razze di cavalli addomesticati e ben presto l'idea prese piede e si diffuse rapidamente. Il contributo del cavallo nelle conquiste dell'uomo è stato immenso, rendendo possibili anche le grandi campagne militari di Genghis Khan e Alessandro Magno. A partire dal 16° secolo, gli spagnoli hanno introdotto nel Nordamerica le razze moderne, spesso liberando le proprie mandrie prima di tornare in Europa (creando così spazio fondamentale per oro e altre ricchezze). Malgrado l'importanza dei cavalli sia venuta meno con l'avvento dei motori a combustione interna, sono ancora fondamentali per l'agricoltura e l'intrattenimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El caballo, posiblemente el animal doméstico más útil de la historia de la humanidad, existe desde hace cincuenta millones de años. Aunque se ha producido una evolución significativa (sus primeros antepasados medían menos de treinta centímetros), la apariencia básica del caballo ha permanecido invariable. La primera interacción entre caballos y hombres fue a través de la caza, pues los hombres primitivos se alimentaban de ellos. Alrededor del 2500 a. C. empezaron a aparecer en Asia los primeros indicios de razas domesticadas, pero la idea se propagó rápidamente. Las contribuciones del caballo a las ansias de conquista del hombre fueron inmensas, permitiendo las enormes campañas de Gengis Kan y Alejandro Magno. Los españoles introdujeron la cría moderna en Norteamérica en el siglo XVI, dejando a menudo sueltos a sus rebaños importados antes de volver a Europa (ganando un valioso espacio para el oro y otros tesoros). Aunque la importancia de los caballos ha disminuido desde la aparición del motor de combustión interna, siguen siendo todo un regalo en los ámbitos del entretenimiento y la agricultura.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stables[COLOR_REVERT] allows increased breeding of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]livestock[COLOR_REVERT]. Stables will give protection from harsh weathre during storms and cold winters for your horses. Also your horses can give birth in secure environment.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]écuries[COLOR_REVERT] permettent d'augmenter la production des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]chevaux[COLOR_REVERT]. Une écuries protège vos chevaux des intempéries, des tempêtes durant l'hiver. Si bien que vos chevaux se reproduiront en toute sécurité.
TEXT.German: In [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stallungen[COLOR_REVERT] sind Nutztiere vor kaltem Wetter im Winter geschützt und können in sicherer Umgebung ihre Jungtiere zur Welt bringen. Dadurch lassen sich [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nutztiere[COLOR_REVERT] erfolgreicher züchten. Zur Errichtung der Stallungen und der Ranch wird eine gewisse Zahl von Nutztieren benötigt. Der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]große Viehmarkt[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht eine überregionale Zucht und Vermarktung und steigert die Zucht daher noch einmal zusätzlich.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stables[COLOR_REVERT] allows increased breeding of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]livestock[COLOR_REVERT]. Stables will give protection from harsh weather during storms and cold winters for your pups. Also your livestock can give birth in secure environment. The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]grand horse and cattle market[COLOR_REVERT] enables a supraregional trading of livestock and therefore will increase breeding additionally.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Horse Pasture[COLOR_REVERT] is the native equivalent of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stable[COLOR_REVERT]. It can only be built by native civilizations. Players will have to settle for the Stable.
TEXT.French: Chez les indigènes, le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]pâturage[COLOR_REVERT] est l'équivalent de l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]écurie[COLOR_REVERT] du vieux continent. Un pâturage ne peut être créé que par une civilisation indigène. Les joueurs devront apprendre à se contenter d'une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]écurie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pferdeweide[COLOR_REVERT] ist die Ureinwohner-Variante der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stallungen[COLOR_REVERT]. Sie kann nur von Ureinwohner-Zivilisationen errichtet werden. Spieler müssen sich mit den [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stallungen[COLOR_REVERT] begnügen.

TEXT.English: Coconut

Origin of the coconut palm is supposed to be western coast of Southern America. The coconut palm, Cocos nucifera, is a member of the family Arecaceae. It is the only accepted species in the genus Cocos. The term coconut can refer to the entire coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit, which is not a botanical nut. The spelling cocoanut is an old-fashioned form of the word. The term is derived from 16th century Portuguese and Spanish cocos, meaning "grinning face", from the three small holes on the coconut shell that resemble human facial features. Found across much of the tropic and subtropic area, the coconut is known for its great versatility as seen in the many domestic, commercial, and industrial uses of its different parts. Coconuts are part of the daily diet of many people. Its endosperm is known as the edible "flesh" of the coconut; when dried it is called copra. The oil and milk derived from it are commonly used in cooking and frying; coconut oil is also widely used in soaps and cosmetics. The clear liquid coconut water within is a refreshing drink and can be processed to create alcohol. The husks and leaves can be used as material to make a variety of products for furnishing and decorating. It also has cultural and religious significance in many societies that use it.

The clear liquid coconut water within is a refreshing drink and can be processed to create alcohol. The husks and leaves can be used as material to make a variety of products for furnishing and decorating. It also has cultural and religious significance in many societies that use it.
TEXT.German: Ursprung der Kokosnusspalme is wahrscheinlich die westliche Küste von Südamerika. Die Kokosnusspalme, Cocos nucifera, gehört zur Familie der Arecaceae. Der Ausdruck Kokosnuss can sich auf die gesamte Kokosnusspalme, den Samen oder die Frucht, die aus botanischer Sicht eine Nuss ist, beziehen. Das Wort "cocos" lietet sich aus dem spanischen oder portugiesischen Begriff des 16ten Jahrhunderts ab, welcher "grinsendes Gesicht" bedeutet, da die drei Löcher in der Schale einen menschlichen Gesicht ähneln. Fast über das gesamte tropische oder subtropische Gebiet verteilt, ist die Kokosnuss für ihre Vielseitigkeit bekannt, da Teile in vielseitigen Bereichen verwendet werden können. Sie sind Teil der täglichen Nahrung einer großen Anzahl von Menschen. Das getrocknete Fleisch der Kokosnuss wird auch "Copra" genannt. Das Kokosnussöl und die Kokosnussmilch werden oft zum Kochen verwendet. Des weiteren wird Kokosnussöl in Seifen oder Kosmetikprodukten verwendet. Kokosnussmilch dient als erfrischendes Getränk und kann auch zu Alkohol weiterverarbeitet werden. Auch die Schale oder die Palmblätter können vielseitig verwendet werden. In vielen Gesellschaften hat die Kokosnuss daher sogar religiöse und kulturelle Bedeutung gewonnen.
TEXT.Italian: Origin of the coconut palm is supposed to be western coast of Southern America. The coconut palm, Cocos nucifera, is a member of the family Arecaceae. It is the only accepted species in the genus Cocos. The term coconut can refer to the entire coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit, which is not a botanical nut. The spelling cocoanut is an old-fashioned form of the word. The term is derived from 16th century Portuguese and Spanish cocos, meaning "grinning face", from the three small holes on the coconut shell that resemble human facial features. Found across much of the tropic and subtropic area, the coconut is known for its great versatility as seen in the many domestic, commercial, and industrial uses of its different parts. Coconuts are part of the daily diet of many people. Its endosperm is known as the edible "flesh" of the coconut; when dried it is called copra. The oil and milk derived from it are commonly used in cooking and frying; coconut oil is also widely used in soaps and cosmetics. The clear liquid coconut water within is a refreshing drink and can be processed to create alcohol. The husks and leaves can be used as material to make a variety of products for furnishing and decorating. It also has cultural and religious significance in many societies that use it.

TEXT.English: Turkeys

The domesticated turkey is a large poultry bird. The modern domesticated form descends from the wild turkey, one of the two species of turkey; in the past the ocellated turkey (a species of turkey residing primarily in the Yucatn Peninsula)was also domesticated. The modern domesticated turkey is descended from one of six subspecies of wild turkey: Meleagris gallopavo gallopavo, found in the area bounded by the present Mexican states of Jalisco, Guerrero, and Veracruz Ancient Mesoamericans domesticated this subspecies; they used its meat and eggs as major sources of protein and employed its feathers extensively for decorative purposes. The Aztecs associated the turkey with their trickster god Tezcatlipoca, perhaps because of its humorous behavior.

TEXT.German: Der domestizierte Truthahn, is a sehr großer Vogel. Die moderne domestizierte Form des Truthahns stammt von einer von sechs Subspezies des wilden Truthahns ab: Meleagris gallopavo gallopavo, welcher in der Gegend des heutigen Mexiko gefunden wurde. Die erste Domestizierung fand voraussichtlich durch die frühen Mesoamericaner statt. Diese nutzen das Fleisch und die Eier als Hauptquelle für Proteinen und die Federn sehr extensive für dekorative Zwecke. Die Azteken verbanden den Truthahn mit ihrem Gauner-Gott Tezcatlipoca. Vermutlich aufgrund seines teilweise seltsam wirkenden Verhalten.

TEXT.English: Pumpkins

[TAB]A pumpkin is a gourd-like squash of the genus Cucurbita and the family Cucurbitaceae (which also includes gourds). It commonly refers to cultivars of any one of the species Cucurbita pepo, Cucurbita mixta, Cucurbita maxima, and Cucurbita moschata, and is native to North America. They typically have a thick, orange or yellow shell, creased from the stem to the bottom, containing the seeds and pulp.
TEXT.French: [TAB]A pumpkin is a gourd-like squash of the genus Cucurbita and the family Cucurbitaceae (which also includes gourds). It commonly refers to cultivars of any one of the species Cucurbita pepo, Cucurbita mixta, Cucurbita maxima, and Cucurbita moschata, and is native to North America. They typically have a thick, orange or yellow shell, creased from the stem to the bottom, containing the seeds and pulp.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die verschiedenen Arten von Kürbissen wurden großteils unabhängig für die gleiche Verwendung domestiziert. Als Zeitpunkt wurde lange etwa 5000 v. Chr. angenommen, was nach Phaseolus und Capsicum wäre. Neuere Funde von Samen domestizierter Kürbisse sind jedoch auf 8000 bis 10.000 v. Chr. zu datieren.[1] Der Garten-Kürbis wurde in Mexiko und im Süden der USA domestiziert, der Moschus-Kürbis in Zentral-Amerika und der Riesen-Kürbis in Südamerika. Es wird angenommen, dass ursprünglich die nahrhaften Samen genutzt wurden, da diese frei von Bitterstoffen sind, während alle Wildformen bittere Früchte besitzen. Durch die Auslese nichtbitterer Formen wurde auch die Nutzung als Gemüse möglich. Schon in präkolumbischer Zeit gab es eine große Sortenvielfalt. Bereits früh kamen Samen auch nach Europa, wo die Kürbisse gerne kultiviert wurden. Die Gattung ist ursprünglich ausschließlich in Amerika beheimatet. Kultiviert werden die domestizierten Arten heute weltweit in den warmen Gebieten.

TEXT.English: Melons

[TAB]Melon is a name given to various members of the plant family Cucurbitaceae with sweet flavored, fleshy fruit e.g. gourds or cucurbits. Melon can be referred as a plant or a fruit. Many different cultivars have been produced, particularly of muskmelons. The plant grows as a vine. Although the melon is a fruit, some varieties may be considered "culinary vegetables". The word melon derives from Latin melopepo, which is the latinization of the Greek (melopepon), meaning "melon", itself a compound of (melon), "apple" + p?p?? (pepon), amongst others "a kind of gourd or melon".

TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Melone bezeichnet man vor allem in subtropischen Gebieten kultivierte Gewächse mit großen, saftreichen Beeren-Früchten (botanischen Gemüsen). Sie gehören zur Familie der Kürbisgewächse (Cucurbitaceae), werden also genau genommen als Gemüse bezeichnet. Der deutsche Name ist von dem griechischen Wort für "Apfel" abgeleitet. Es wird hauptsächlich zwischen Zuckermelonen und Wassermelonen unterschieden. Melonen werden in der Botanik nicht als Verwandtschaftsgruppe angesehen, die Zuckermelonen (Cucumis melo) sind enger mit den Gurken verwandt als mit den Wassermelonen (Citrullus lanatus). Die Frucht wird aufgrund der harten Schale als Panzerbeere bezeichnet.

TEXT.English: [TAB] In sailing, a brigantine is a vessel with two masts, only the forward of which is square rigged. Originally the brigantine was a small ship carrying both oars and sails. It was a favorite of Mediterranean pirates and its name comes from the Italian word brigantino, meaning brigand, and applied by extension to his ship. By the 17th century the term meant a two-masted ship. In the late 17th century, the Royal Navy used the term brigantine to refer to small two-masted vessels designed to be rowed as well as sailed, rigged with square rigs on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigging on the mainmast. By the first half of the 18th century the word had evolved to refer not to a ship type name, but rather to a particular type of rigging: square rigged on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigged on the mainmast. The word "brig" is an 18th century shortening of the word brigantine, which came to mean a vessel square-rigged on both masts. The early Oxford English Dictionary (with citations from 1720 to 1854) still defined brig as being either identical to a brigantine, or alternatively, a vessel of similar sail plan to a modern brig.

It was a favorite of Mediterranean pirates and its name comes from the Italian word brigantino, meaning brigand, and applied by extension to his ship. By the 17th century the term meant a two-masted ship. In the late 17th century, the Royal Navy used the term brigantine to refer to small two-masted vessels designed to be rowed as well as sailed, rigged with square rigs on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigging on the mainmast. By the first half of the 18th century the word had evolved to refer not to a ship type name, but rather to a particular type of rigging: square rigged on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigged on the mainmast. The word "brig" is an 18th century shortening of the word brigantine, which came to mean a vessel square-rigged on both masts. The early Oxford English Dictionary (with citations from 1720 to 1854) still defined brig as being either identical to a brigantine, or alternatively, a vessel of similar sail plan to a modern brig.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Eine Brigantine ist ein Segelschiff mit zwei Masten, deren vorderer mit Fockmast, der hintere mit Großmast bezeichnet werden. Am Fockmast führt eine Brigantine Rahsegel; am Großmast führt sie teilweise oder ausschließlich Schratsegel. Die Brigantine stellt daher eine Mischform aus Brigg und Schoner dar. Sie kann durch ihre Rahsegel Wind von hinten (raumen Wind) besser ausnutzen als ein Schoner; außerdem kann sie durch ihre Schratsegel höher am Wind segeln als eine Brigg, das heißt, sie kann besser "schräg gegen den Wind" segeln. Ende des 17. Jahrhunderts wurde die Bezeichnung in Nordwesteuropa auf zweimastige, rahgetakelte Segelschiffe übertragen. Seit dem 19. Jahrhundert entstand die heutige Bedeutung des Wortes Brigantine. Je nach Takelung werden verschiedene Segelschiffstypen unterschieden, die heute zusammenfassend als Brigantine bezeichnet werden. Der meist einfach als Brigantine bezeichnete Typ führt am Großmast ein Gaffelsegel und darüber weitere Rahsegel.

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.
TEXT.French: Un navire de commerce sr, solide et fiable.
TEXT.German: Eine [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] ist ein starkes, gut geschütztes Handelsschiff.
TEXT.Italian: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.
TEXT.Spanish: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.

TEXT.English: [TAB] In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship (also known as one of the escort types) with a single gun deck that carried anything up to eighteen cannons. As the rating system covered all vessels with 20 guns and above, this meant that the term sloop-of-war actually encompassed all the unrated combat vessels including the very small gun-brigs and cutters. In technical terms, even the more specialised bomb vessels and fireships were classed as sloops-of-war, and in practice these were actually employed in the sloop role when not carrying out their specialised functions. A ship sloop was generally the equivalent of the smaller corvette of the French Navy (although the French term also covered ships up up to 24 guns, which were classed as 'post ships' within the Sixth Rate of the British Navy). The name corvette was subsequently also applied to British vessels, but not until the 1830s. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". Until 1794 the master and commander strictly speaking held the permenent rank of lieutenant, and reverted to that rank when he gave up command of the sloop-of-war; in 1794 the rank of commander was created.

TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Kriegsschiffbezeichnung Sloop hat ihren Ursprung in dem gleichnamigen einmastigen Schiffstyp. Sie bildeten im 17. Jahrhundert die kleinsten bewaffneten Marineeinheiten für Unterstützungsaufgaben wie Nachrichtenübermittlung und Aufklärung und waren im Gegensatz zu grösseren Schiffen nicht klassifiziert. Diese Fahrzeuge hatten zunächst einen Leutnant als Kommandanten, jedoch ohne weiteren Offizier, vor allem aber keinen Navigator/Segelmeister (engl. Sailing-Master oder kurz Master). Weil Unterstützungsfahrzeuge in der Seekriegsführung im Verlaufe des 17. Jahrhundert immer bedeutender wurden und vor allem auch abseits der Küsten operierten, wurde auch ein Navigator notwendig. Daraus entstand der Rang des Master and Commander, ein kommandierender Seeoffizier, der zugleich Navigator war.

TEXT.English: Although not very strong, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent for reconaissance and finishing off damaged ships.

French.Text: Navire des Indes Orientales:Navires des Indes Orientales

TEXT.English: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Großer Westindienfahrer wurden entworfen und gebaut um sowohl Passagiere, wie auch Waren zu transportieren. Ein Hauptaugenmerk, war die Fähigkeit sich gegen Piraten zu verteidigen. Durch diese speziellen Eigenschaften stellten sie eine eigene Schiffsklasse dar. Für einen Angreifer ware sie aus der Entfernung oft kaum von einem reinen Kriegsschiff zu unterscheiden. Einige waren tatsächlich relativ schwach bewaffnet, andere jedoch führten eine beachtliche Anzahl an Kanonen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiaman[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong trading ship, although it lacks some cargo capacity compared to the Galeon due to the higher amount of cannons.

TEXT.English: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.French: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Schmugglerschiffe wurden meist sehr günstig und vorallem zweckmässig gebaut. Oft aus günstigerem Holz, wie Tanne. Verglichen mit den traditionellen Bauweisen mit Eiche und anderen Harthölzern, sparte dies nicht nur Kosten, sondern auch Gewicht, was wiederum zu höheren Endgeschwindigkeiten führte um den Königlichen Zollschiffen zu entgehen. Bewaffnet waren Schmugglerschiffe meist nur mit leichten Handwaffen.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Rangers berufen sich auf die Tradition der ersten Siedler in den USA, die unter Ausnutzung des Geländes gegen Indianer und britische oder französische Truppen kämpften. Namenspatron sind Rogers' Rangers, die unter Robert Rogers auf britischer Seite im Franzosen- und Indianerkrieg kämpften. Dessen zusammengestellter Ausbildungsplan aus Berichten der Rogers Ranger sind u.a. bis heute noch Grundlage des Kleinen Krieges. Auch im amerikanischen Bürgerkrieg waren Ranger-Einheiten, vor allem auf konföderierter Seite als Bushwhacker, hinter den feindlichen Linien eingesetzt.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Conquistadores sind Berufssoldaten, die ein breites Spektrum von Kampftaktiken und Waffen einsetzten. Ihre Verbände spezialisierten sich oft auf Kriegsführung, die langes Training bedurfte und für andere Truppenteile zu kostspielig war. Viele junge Europäer traten Einheiten von Conquistadores bei, weil sie sich dadurch einen Weg aus der Armut versprachen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.French: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kolonisierung Amerikas vom 16. bis 19. Jahrhundert ging mit einer Massenversklavung von Afrikanern einher, die in allen Teilen des dünn besiedelten Doppelkontinents als billige Arbeitskräfte eingesetzt wurden. Dies betrifft nicht nur die britischen, niederländischen, schwedischen, französischen und spanischen Kolonien, aus denen später die USA entstanden sind, sondern in noch grösserem Umfang Brasilien und die europäischen Kolonien in der Karibik. Auf dem nordamerikanischen Festland erlangte die Sklaverei jedoch Ausprägungsformen, die auf dem Doppelkontinent einzigartig waren, und nach der Gründung der USA stand sie im Spannungsfeld zwischen einer Ökonomie, die auf der Arbeitsleistung von Sklaven erbaut war, und dem politischen Programm einer jungen Nation, deren Selbstverständnis prominent die Idee der Freiheit zugrundelag.

Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It is the task and responsibility of a bishop to act as spiritual leader of a colony. Guiding and supporting other preachers and priests to bring true christian believe to the citizens, converting the savages and to ensure that no soul leaves the righteous path of enlightment. Bringing bishops to your colonies is a save way to drastically increas immigration from the old world.

Einen Bischof in die Kolonien zu bringen ist eine sichere Methode die Immigration wesentlich zu erhöhen.

TEXT.English: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.
TEXT.French: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.
TEXT.German: Während des Zeitalters der Selgelschiffe waren Corvette kleinere bis mittlere Kriegsschiffe. Die Aufgabe der Corvette bestand üblicherweise aus Küstenpatroulien und Unterstüzung grösserer Flotten. Die Englische Navy begann die Nutzung solcher Schiffe in den 1650ern, nannte sie aber zu beginn eher Sloop-Of-War, als Corvette. Die erste namentliche Reference einer Corvette findet sich in der Französichen Marine um 1670 und gilt als der Ursprung dieser Bezeichnugn. Die Bezeichnung Corvette diente ab diesem Zeitpunkt zur Beschreibung eines Schiffes, welches kleiner als eine Frigatte, aber grösser als eine Sloop war.

The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and very well suited for hunting Privateers. However, they are no real match for bigger warships like Frigates, Ships of the Line or Man-O-Wars and also cannot bombard cities.

Desweiteren können sie keine Städte bombardieren.

French.Text: Caravelle à coque arrondie:Caravelles à coques arrondies

TEXT.English: Towards the end of the 15th century, the caravel was occasionally modified by giving it the same rig as a carrack with a foresail, square mainsail and lateen mizzen, but not the carrack's high forecastle or much of a sternpalace, which would make it unweatherly. In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). It was in such ships that Christopher Columbus set out on his expedition in 1492 - Santa Maria was a ~100 ton carrack (same as: nau) which served as the flagship, and Pinta and Nia were smaller caravels of around 15-20 m with a beam of 6 m and displacing around 60-75 tons. In the first half of the 16th century, the Portuguese created a specialized fighting ship also called caravela redonda to act as an escort in Brazil and in the East Indies route. It had a foremast with square sails and three other masts with a lateen each, for a total of 4 masts. The hull was galleon-shaped, and some experts consider this vessel a forerunner of the fighting galleon. The Portuguese Man o' War was named after this curious type of fighting ship which was in use until the 17th century.
TEXT.French: Towards the end of the 15th century, the caravel was occasionally modified by giving it the same rig as a carrack with a foresail, square mainsail and lateen mizzen, but not the carrack's high forecastle or much of a sternpalace, which would make it unweatherly. In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). It was in such ships that Christopher Columbus set out on his expedition in 1492 - Santa Maria was a ~100 ton carrack (same as: nau) which served as the flagship, and Pinta and Nia were smaller caravels of around 15-20 m with a beam of 6 m and displacing around 60-75 tons. In the first half of the 16th century, the Portuguese created a specialized fighting ship also called caravela redonda to act as an escort in Brazil and in the East Indies route. It had a foremast with square sails and three other masts with a lateen each, for a total of 4 masts. The hull was galleon-shaped, and some experts consider this vessel a forerunner of the fighting galleon. The Portuguese Man o' War was named after this curious type of fighting ship which was in use until the 17th century.
TEXT.German: Gegen Ende des 15ten Jahrunderts wurde die Caravelle manchmal modfifiziert indem man ihr ein Rig-Segel als Frontsegel, ein Rechteck-Segel als Hauptsegel und ein Lateen-Selge in der Mitte gabe, aber nicht aber nicht die hohen Anbauten an Front und Bug anbrachte. In dieser Form war sie als Caravela Redonda bekannt. In solchen Schiffen setzte Christoph Columbus Segel für seine Expedition im Jahre 1492. In der ersten Hälfte des 16ten Jahrunderts setzten die Portugiesen diese Schiffe auch als Eskorten auf ihren Handelsrouten nach Brasilien ein.
TEXT.Italian: Towards the end of the 15th century, the caravel was occasionally modified by giving it the same rig as a carrack with a foresail, square mainsail and lateen mizzen, but not the carrack's high forecastle or much of a sternpalace, which would make it unweatherly. In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). It was in such ships that Christopher Columbus set out on his expedition in 1492 - Santa Maria was a ~100 ton carrack (same as: nau) which served as the flagship, and Pinta and Nia were smaller caravels of around 15-20 m with a beam of 6 m and displacing around 60-75 tons. In the first half of the 16th century, the Portuguese created a specialized fighting ship also called caravela redonda to act as an escort in Brazil and in the East Indies route. It had a foremast with square sails and three other masts with a lateen each, for a total of 4 masts. The hull was galleon-shaped, and some experts consider this vessel a forerunner of the fighting galleon. The Portuguese Man o' War was named after this curious type of fighting ship which was in use until the 17th century.
TEXT.Spanish: Towards the end of the 15th century, the caravel was occasionally modified by giving it the same rig as a carrack with a foresail, square mainsail and lateen mizzen, but not the carrack's high forecastle or much of a sternpalace, which would make it unweatherly. In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). It was in such ships that Christopher Columbus set out on his expedition in 1492 - Santa Maria was a ~100 ton carrack (same as: nau) which served as the flagship, and Pinta and Nia were smaller caravels of around 15-20 m with a beam of 6 m and displacing around 60-75 tons. In the first half of the 16th century, the Portuguese created a specialized fighting ship also called caravela redonda to act as an escort in Brazil and in the East Indies route. It had a foremast with square sails and three other masts with a lateen each, for a total of 4 masts. The hull was galleon-shaped, and some experts consider this vessel a forerunner of the fighting galleon. The Portuguese Man o' War was named after this curious type of fighting ship which was in use until the 17th century.
